title: Spinach, Mushroom, and Goat Cheese Slab Frittata
source: Smitten Kitchen Every Day - Deb Perelman
ingredients: ½ pound (225 grams) breakfast sausage, removed from casings (optional)
½ pound (225 grams) white or cremini mushrooms, thinly sliced
1 teaspoon kosher or coarse sea salt, plus more to taste
directions: Heat the oven to 350°F, and butter a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Prepare the spinach: Wilt in a skillet or steam in ½ inch water, then drain and squeeze out liquid. Coarsely chop.

In the same skillet, heat olive oil. Cook sausage until browned. Remove and reserve. Sauté onion and garlic, then add mushrooms and cook until liquid evaporates. Add cream, salt, pepper, nutmeg, spinach, and sausage. Simmer and then cool.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, salt, and pepper. Stir in veggie mixture, scallions, and goat cheese. Pour into prepared dish.
Bake 30 minutes until golden and set. Cool 5 minutes before cutting into squares.
